STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 10, 2022
Brian Millikin
Midland/Gladwin County DHHS
1509 Washington Ste A
Midland, MI 48641
RE: License #: CP560201302
Midland/Gladwin County DHHS
1509 Washington Ste A
Midland, MI 48641
Dear Mr. Millikin:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
05/10/2022. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 5 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child
in a foster home, then both of the following shall be
documented before a change in placement:
(a) A summary of the services provided during care up
to the time of the change in placement and the needs that
remain to be met.
One of the two discharged foster care records reviewed did not include the
documentation for the discharge of the youth. In this example the youth was
identified as being discharged01/26/2022 and the 69b could not be located to
document this change in placement as required.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Two of the eight current foster child records reviewed included at least one updated
service plan that was not completed within the timeline established by this rule. In
the first example the youth had an updated service plan due 09/27/2021 that was
completed 04/13/2022 and a second service plan that was due 12/26/2021 that was
identified as completed 04/14/2022. The second youth had an updated service plan
due 02/07/2022 that was identified as completed 02/09/2022.
R 400.12511 Independent living contract.
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living services
for a youth, the agency shall document all of the following
information in the case record within 30 calendar days of
termination of its services:
(a) The reason for the termination.
The one discharged independent living record that was reviewed did not include
documentation of the discharge information (69b) as required by this rule.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
4

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
"FOM 722-06B Family Team Meetings. The following events shall trigger
FTM for out of home cases:
• Case service plan development,
One of the eight current foster child records reviewed indicated a Family Team Meeting
had not occurred as required by this rule. In this example the youth did not have a Family
Team Meeting for the time period 11/10/2021 to 02/7/2022 as required by this standard.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
There was discussion related to the need for dated and signed documents to be
uploaded into the information system and the use of the standard format for the Chief
Administrator Assessment.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
There was discussion related to the expectations for youth who are identified as strictly
juvenile justice cases.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for the interim evaluation completed
08/04/2021. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that review were 306(4),
324(4), 326(1)(e)(h), 327(1)(a) (6)(b), 405(4), 413(2), and ISEP 4.22. The corrective
action plan was approved 09/03/2021 and none of these areas were identified as
repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment included a review of the areas of noncompliance
and assessment of compliance with the approved corrective action plan. A monthly
review of documents being loaded into the information system is also included.
Interviews
Social service staff were involved in entrance and exit interviews and no concerns were
noted.
5

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
05/11/2022
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 11, 2022
________________________________________
Date
Area Manager
